feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The submission demonstrates a working financial tool: it ingests spending by card/category, computes rewards and net outcomes, and produces optimization recommendations. Implementation and testing details (calculation outputs and debugging) show the app performs the intended financial tasks, meeting PASS criteria.
- Integrate AI: The student demonstrates a working AI integration that produces substantive analyses and tailored recommendations, and they resolved implementation issues (error handling) and improved output via prompt engineering. This shows effective, value-adding AI use beyond superficial placement, meeting the PASS standard for this criterion.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "So, I created this credit card reality check to help answer that uh question."

"you can analyze your spending. And uh to validate or testing my work, you can see right here it it calculates the total rewards earned. So I earned a total of $12.60 versus baseline spending minus $30. Net result $12.60."

"It gives you your analysis. It gives you a recommendation. I can get a it tells me to get a dining focus card or check if any of my exist existing cards have rotary rotating quarterly categories. It gives me a breakdown and a bottom line."
criteria.driver_alignment: DISCOVER — identified a concrete financial problem and goal (tracking credit-card-driven spending vs. savings). IMPLEMENT — built the "credit card reality check," performed calculations, and debugged AI-call/error handling. REFLECT — iterated on AI prompting and reliability, showing functional refinement.
criteria.reasoning: The submission demonstrates a working financial tool: it ingests spending by card/category, computes rewards and net outcomes, and produces optimization recommendations. Implementation and testing details (calculation outputs and debugging) show the app performs the intended financial tasks, meeting PASS criteria.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "the AI analysis is that I'm actually doing well this month. Spending $30 less than usual while earning $1260 in rewards gives you a net positive of $4260. However, my card optimization could work since I'm leaving money on table with that $90 dining purchase on Discover. Um, it gives you your analysis. It gives you a recommendation."
"the hardest part I think was making I AI call uh call work reliably. Fixed it by adding error handling."

"So what I learned about building AI is that prompting everything. You know my first version uh gave a genetic uh generic advice. So I explicit I had to explicit explicitly tell Gemini and Claude to be brutally honest by overspending."
criteria.driver_alignment:
- Discover: identified a clear user problem and goal motivating AI use (help college students check if rewards mask overspending).
- Implement: described building the AI call, handling reliability issues, and producing analysis + recommendations.
- Reflect: discussed prompt engineering and iterative improvements with specific models (Gemini, Claude), showing learning from testing.
criteria.reasoning: The student demonstrates a working AI integration that produces substantive analyses and tailored recommendations, and they resolved implementation issues (error handling) and improved output via prompt engineering. This shows effective, value-adding AI use beyond superficial placement, meeting the PASS standard for this criterion.
